result.title: Hints for Week 3
result.content:
A. Mr. Kitayuta, the Treasure Hunter

DP.

dp[i][j] = max number of gems you can collect from the first i islands if you finish at island number i with a jump length of j

Try to prove that you wont need more than 500 values of j.

B. Maximum Xor Secondary

Use the stack to compute the first element to the right of each index i that is just greater than a[i]. Let's call the index of such an element j.

R2D2 and Droid Army

Greedy. You need to implement a sliding window algorithm over each type of weapon for a droid. Implement this sliding window using the queue using 2 stacks trick.

Non-Secret Cypher

You need to use a queue where in you push elements to the end of the queue if the frequency of all elements in the queue is less than K. Once the frequency of at least one element becomes K, let's say at index i, pop elements from the Q till the frequency is K and add n-i+1 for each pop.

Maximum Submatrix 2

DP and counting sort.

dp[i][j] = maximum horizontal sequence of 1's that ends at column j of row i. This will be the lengths of the submatrix

For each j from 1 to n, sort dp[i][j] for i from 1 to n using counting sort. If dp[k][j] is the length of the desired submatrix, then we can rearrange the rows so that all rows with dp[k'][j] >= dp[k][j] are together. Then the area for the submatrix will be dp[k][j] * (# of rows with dp[k'][j] >= dp[k][j])
